Reviews.Title: “nice room, good location, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ProfTraveler58
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, but nothing really beyond what you'd expect for a hotel in this price range. Staff was inconsistent--from very helpful and courteous to fairly indifferent. The service in the restaurant was inattentive at best...food just OK--visit St. Paul Street (about a 2-3 block walk) for better food options. Hard to imagine a better location if you are visiting Johns Hopkins;

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: happygolucky291
Reviews.Content: Look at the map and you can see why you'd want to stay here - walk just across the road into the Johns Hopkins campus. Front desk staff were charming, as were the waiting staff in the restaurant (though they did struggle a wee bit to keep up at breakfast time!). The food was good, too. Didn't explore public transport into downtown Baltimore - just stepped straight into a cab on the hotel forecourt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to Johns Hopkins University”
Reviews.Author: ChooChoo4427
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Nicely appointed rooms, well sized with two Queen beds. We like that the sink and shower/toilet are separated so that both can be used at the same time. Nice size, 42+ inch flat screen TV. There was a distinct lack of accessible power outlets. One by the coffee machine and one near the sink. All others required moving furniture. Nice fitness room with a good # of machines. No pool (I think it was seasonal). Parking was $24/night self park or $28/night valet (with in/out privs). Internet was free!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location...”
Reviews.Author: barbara m
Reviews.Content: Our most recent stay was in March for two nights. We've stayed here many times here as it is the only option if you want to be close to the Johns Hopkins Homewood campus. So while it's not bad, and the staff in the lobby are really quite nice, it can be expensive for what you get (I believe rates are adjusted higher for weekends with home lacrosse games). The lobby is very nice. The rooms are dark & sort of dated, the bathrooms are small and the tile walls of the bathrooms have several non-functional timer dials, along with many spackled spots from what must be an attempt at updating. We stopped going to the restaurant, but one can hope that it has improved! Even after everything I've said, we would probably return if we wanted to stay close to JHU.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pwallace650
Reviews.Content: My family (5 of us) stayed at the hotel for 3 nights for a family reunion, and had a very good time there. We were near all the places we had to go, including JHU. The 2 adjoining rooms (each with double queens) were big enough, clean and tidy. The beds were comfortable. Bathroom water was hot, which we liked! The rooms were also the right temperature for us. We were treated very well by all the staff in the hotel we interacted with--front desk, valet parking, and house keeping. We asked for extra hangers--they arrived immediately. We made use of the valet service, and found them to be extremely helpful. Only negatives were that parking and restaurant seemed a litlte expensive to us, but wifi was free.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: AlexLesya
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and staff attentive. That being said, the thermostat had a mind of it's own, the shower water pressure was that of a fireman's hose With no way to alter it and there were no towel racks in the bathroom. Also the restaurant was overpriced. I wouldn't choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good hospitality”
Reviews.Author: zebra1213
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to visit Johns Hopkins. Great location for this purpose. The service was excellent. Yummy cookies. Parking is a little pricey but probably no more than other places in the area. The breakfast was ok, not the greatest. The room was pretty standard. Beds were comfortable, bathroom was very small. The bathroom door barely cleared the toilet to close. Would definitely stay here again if I visit Johns Hopkins again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Antony V
Reviews.Content: Two-night stay in March 2012 for an off-site conference. Clean and confortable rooom, clean sheets and towels; hot water; polite and attentive staff; charming bartender; convenient parking. Excellent in every way. Don't visit Baltimore often, but next time I do, I'll be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond...”
Reviews.Author: Gregory B
Reviews.Content: 3/1/12 Mr. Steve Nyitrai General Manager Inn at the Colonnade Baltimore Doubletree Hilton 4 West University Parkway Baltimore, MD, 21218-2306 Dear Mr Nyitrai, This past Saturday (2/25), my wife and I stayed at your hotel and because of my Diamond status your staff graciously upgraded us to a King Suite, room 338. By the time we departed the next day we were already very impressed with your staff and facility (including the night doorman who proved to be very helpful when we came in from a show at Johns Hopkins at about 11:30pm) but became even more so later. When we arrived back home in Richmond on Sunday afternoon, I discovered that I had left my camera bag inclusive of ALL of my camera equipment and hundreds of pictures I had taken the previous evening, in my hotel room. It was a not too smart move on my part, and as you might imagine, caused me a great deal of immediate worry. From the moment of my first call to your hotel to report this problem, I was treated exceptionally well by every involved member of your staff. My first contact was with Michele Sipe, front desk associate, who managed the process expertly, and most importantly, with a great attitude. To the full credit of your housekeeper, once she found my bag, she quickly realized it was too important to put it in the usual “lost and found” location and immediately brought it to Michele at the front desk personally. Her name is Jauanda Seldon. I am exceptionally grateful for her fast action. It really put my mind at ease to know that my equipment was secured so quickly. As I was driving to work on Monday morning I received a call from your head of housekeeping, Novella McCall. She explained to me how and when she was going to ship my bag back to me. She was very professional and helpful. To round things out, by the time I got to work I had an e-mail from Michele giving me the full details of the transaction including my FEDEX tracking number, and all was arranged at the most economical rate possible. (I expect delivery tomorrow at my home) If I was asked to supply you with just one word to summarize the handling of this situation by your staff, it would be WOW!!! My expectations could not have been more greatly exceeded. I have enclosed three envelopes. They contain a note and token of my appreciation for the excellent work performed by each of the employees I mentioned above. I would be greatly honored if you would distribute them in person. Thank you for running such a fine establishment. It will be one my wife and I will be sure to visit again. Warmly, Gregory D. Blake

Reviews.Title: “I wasn't paying but I still suffered”
Reviews.Author: sbsElPasoUSA
Reviews.Content: The heat in this hotel was and didn't work properly and I froze. I had them look at it 4 times Net result my performance was poor. Room service was outrageously expensive and the food was cold. There was a built in service charge paid to the server but she still hung around hinting for more. Typical Baltimore over priced and under provision.

Reviews.Title: “Best Desk Supervisor in town”
Reviews.Author: FJ F
Reviews.Content: Desk Supervisor Terrell Brownlee makes me feel like a VIP everytime I stay at this hotel. The hotel lobby is very nicely appointed, the restaurant serves pretty good food. The guest floors and guest rooms are a tad bit dark and cheaply furnished, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is great; the hotel's promises are not kept”
Reviews.Author: Martha C
Reviews.Content: First, I'd like to say that the staff at the front desk, the valet parking, in the dining room and at the bar were lovely and responsive. The first problem was that my 2 daughters and I used a LOT of our Hilton points to stay in what was called the Presidential Suite. We were then assigned to the Family Suite which was different (though probably larger than) the Presidential but we wanted to be in the same room and there were two bedrooms, While theTV in the living room worked, the TV in each bedroom did not so the promise of 3 TVs's was not met. When I tried to call the front desk from my bed, the phone was disconnected from any outlet with no wire in sight. Then I went to the well advertised fitness center where there was a dirty towel lying around and only one clean on left; where the elliptical machine shut down completely if you slowed or paused for one second....I literally had to Quick Start it about 10 times. Even though the staff is lovely, they cannot create good customer feeling when what is promised is not delivered.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ting w
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from the hand center. Great place. Clean, easy to get to. great service. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever Service”
Reviews.Author: brogo413
Reviews.Content: Johns Hopkins University invited a guest to one of our seminars. When our guest became ill overnight, the Inn at The Colonnade did everything imaginable to make this guests' stay as pleasant as possible given the circumstances. Chasity Michailov was outstanding! We tip our hat to you Chasity! Top notch service and people and I recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sherisiple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Colonnade and we had a wonderful experience there. The room was very nice and spacious and looked like it had been recently renovated. The hotel was also very clean and maintained well. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The location was also very convenient and close to many attractions. The hotel restaurant was also excellent and the food was wonderful. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “pattyvolvo@aol.com”
Reviews.Author: patty g
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Colonnade. I must say I was extremely impressed with the staff and overall appearance of the hotel. It is obvious that the employees put their customer first and they take every opportunity to ensure your stay is the best it can be!! First rate!!The rooms look like they have been recently renovated. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Roaminggirl1
Reviews.Content: Recently spent two nights at the Colonnade when I dropped off my son at Johns Hopkins. Excellent location, right next to the athletic facilities of the Homewood Campus of Johns Hopkins University across the street. Comfortable rooms, very helpful friendly front desk personnel and the General Manager, Stephen Nyitrai was, was extremely helpful and considerate in straightening out a messed up reservation and relating charges. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: TravelHappy1012
Reviews.Content: I had an unexpected change in plans and the desk clerk forwarded me to the GM. I left a VM and heard back shortly thereafter and he was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location if you visit JHU”
Reviews.Author: exzx
Reviews.Content: It's very convenient if you just go to Baltimore to visit your friends there. Rooms are large, and the service is not bad. Free wireless Internet access was useful too. Generally it's typically a DoubleTree hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Colonnade.”
Reviews.Author: canadianmom1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night pre-cruise out of Baltimore. It was a very nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. We arrived early in the morning and they held our luggage for us in a room until it was time to check-in, meanwhile we went sight-seeing. Our room was modern and very clean. We really loved the big flat screen t.v. in the room. Unfortunately we didn't have enough time to check out the pool we would have liked to use it, hopefully next time we stay there. Check-in and check-out went smoothly and quickly. Overall it is a great hotel, in a nice area and I would recommend it others.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mrsblizz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live close to this hotel but decided to book the New Years eve package that included a room. We were very happy with the hotel and the party. The room was large and had a lot of nice accessories that made it above average. The staff was very friendly, and overall it was a very nice comfortable hotel. The party they hosted on New Years eve was great too. This years theme was a masquerade, and we plan on revisiting the hotel next year for new years eve even if the theme is different. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TrvelBug_CA
Reviews.Content: Room was larger than expected, clean, and very attractively furnished. Lobby is very nicely done with efficient and riendly front desk staff. Free wireless Internet access a plus. Short walk to Johns Hopkins Homewood campus. Good restaurants within walking distance. Will return if work brings me back to this campus.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: VAtourer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Room was large and rather sparsely furnished with view over parking garage. Our main problem was the very poor sound insulation - could hear talking, coughing and other noises from neighboring rooms, which is unacceptable in a property like this. On the positive side, the location for Johns Hopkins is excellent and the check in procedure efficient.

Reviews.Title: “A place to spent anniversary”
Reviews.Author: earl m
Reviews.Content: A great place to spent your anniversary.The people were very friendly.They were quick to help make sure are stay was very enjoyable. The hotel was very well keep. The room we had was the best we have stayed in everything that we need was right there at our reach.Michele who checked us in was great, we well be going back as often as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nycboylikestravel
Reviews.Content: We had booked (and prepaid) a 2-room suite at this hotel primarily for its location, right across from Johns Hopkins. We arrived about an hour before official check in time and were told they'd call us when the room was ready. While watching a soccer game at Hopkins we received a call that the room was ready. Once we got to the hotel we were asked to wait while the room was being made ready for us, and we also learned that it was not a 2 room suite, but rather a double. We then spent more than an hour arguing with the check-in staff about why there was no suite available when we had paid for one weeks earlier. There were phone calls to the manager who had left for the day, but no resolution. Eventually, we just gave up and took a double. While we were unpacking we received a call from downstairs asking one of us to come down. As it turned out, they did suddenly have a suite available for us, and they offered us free breakfast for the grief we experienced. It's a shame, because the suite turned out to be pretty nice, and the location to Hopkins is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The best service I have ever had at any hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ethannezra
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to visit the baltimore area! John Hopkins university is directly across the street, it is in a great location. Rooms are nice, and clean!!! And the service is by far superior than any other hotel my husband or I have stayed..... The general manager, personal helped make sure our stay was as comfortable and best as it could be, thank you Steve!! Also the room service was delicious because the food was directly sent up from the Alizee, (hotels full service restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Used to be better”
Reviews.Author: parth
Reviews.Content: I go to baltimore every year for work and stay at this place. I never had a complaint before. Work paid for it and this place served the purpose perfectly. Clean rooms, ok gym, and very close to hopkins. This stay wasn't that great though. The bed quality was meh and they decided to forget to deliver my breakfast ( Actually, they delivered it to a colleague of mine for no reason). My wakeup call never happened even though I had set it up. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Slow Internet and Expensive Parking”
Reviews.Author: Cr8zycoach
Reviews.Content: I am sure this hotel is convenient if you are visiting Johns Hopkins. But, for me, as a business traveler doing work around Baltimore, if was very inconvenient. Traffic around the area is terrible. There is parking with no in and out feature, which is super annoying given the cost ($24 per day). The room itself was very nice. I was in a suite because of my honors upgrade. It was spacious. The bathroom seemed recently redone, with tiles in the shower, etc... High class. The wireless internet was PAINFULLY slow. One of the worst I've had travelling in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jakOhio
Reviews.Content: Had to come to Baltimore for a medical consultation at Union Memorial. The Doubletree Inn was in a perfect location, only a few short blocks to the hospital, and right across the street from Johns Hopkins University. This is just a beautiful area of Baltimore. The Inn itself was very nice and well maintained. The staff was outstanding, very courteous and helpful and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The warm cookies at checkin was a nice touch. My only complaint was the parking fee which I felt was a bit high. But, we have to return in December for surgery and we plan on staying there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Highland Park, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Five Star”
Reviews.Author: Betty T
Reviews.Content: Last Thursday I stayed at the Colonnade while I attended a Board meeting at Johns Hopkins Medicine. When I checked out, I left a bag containing all of my medications in my room. I take heart medicine and other major drugs at least twice a day. It was not until this morning when my weekly pill container ran out that I realized I hadn't brought the medications home. The response of the employees at the Colonnade when I called this morning was immediate, courteous, enormously empathic and helpful. Cheryl who answered the phone went out of her way to find a Housekeeping Supervisor, Novella, to assist me in my search. Novella responded to my plight immediately with concern, consideration, and knowledge. She found my medicine bag rapidly and told me of my options for having it returned to me. She took my mailing and credit card information then read it back to me perfectly. She advised me of when it would be sent and when i could expect it tomorrow. In short, she was the model employee who didn't hesitate in responding to a call for help. If you have an Employee of the Month award, I nominate Novella. I frequently stay at the Colonnade because I'm on a series of Boards at Johns Hopkins University and Johns Hopkins Medicine. I love the warm chocolate chip cookies, but I keep returning because you have employees like Novella. If the hotel has no Employee of the Month or similar award, please make time to congratulate her on the way in which she represented your hotel and herself. She deserves to know that going out of her way to help demonstrated that she is an employee of which the Hilton chain, and in particular the Inn at The Colonnade, is proud.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: cab5015
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a weekend away from the kids and the chaos that kids create. It was a lovely stay. The chocolate chip cookies at check-in were warm and delicious and the room was well appointed and clean. This hotel is in the middle of one of Baltimore's premier neighborhoods and walking distance from a few great restaurants(see my review of the Ambassador Dining Room). It is also a great place to stay if your focus is not downtown, but elsewhere in the city, as it is very centrally located. I was even lucky enough to park on the street 1/2 block from the hotel and save the $28 parking fee. The garage is tiny and valet parking is recommended. I did not eat in the restaurant but did have a drink in the bar. Very friendly. It is very close to Johns Hopkins University and many of the university's guest are booked there, which makes for great conversations.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff!”
Reviews.Author: kerust
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and I was once again pleasantly surprised! The hotel staff, from the concierge to the front desk staff, were very helpful and friendly. Everyone always had a smile on their face and went out of their way to make the trip enjoyable! Room service was a little pricey for a basic sandwich, but the quality of the food was good. There is also a little coffee shop in the lobby that has excellent hot chocolate and wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: 65Wagonaire
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel from lobby to guest room. The pool is closed for renovations, which was too bad because I like to swim, but this fact had been disclosed on the web site when I made the reservations. The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you drive your car there, use the valet parking. The self parking prices are a scam, but the front desk staff explained the pricing to us after the valet didn't, so we could make the right choice. I don't go to Baltimore often, but if I go again I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GaryGannaway
Reviews.Content: I frequently visit Baltimore to see my daughters, who attend College at nearby Johns Hopkins, as well as conduct business with Johns Hopkins Hospitals. I always stay at the Doubletree Inn at the Colonnade because of the staff! They’re 1st class! From the moment I book my room with Terrell*, I am treated with kindness and fast service! If there is anything I need, service staff like Sheryl* are quick to jump at the task, ensuring that my stay is comfortable and pleasant! It is people like Terrell and Sheryl that keep me coming back to stay at the Doubletree Inn, time after time. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & even GREATER staff !!!! Steve H. PHX”
Reviews.Author: steve h
Reviews.Content: For me It started at the front deck and Michelle,very friendly and made me feel very welcome.Housekeeping kept me in extra cream for the week with me only leaving (1) one note on my nightstand,WOW !!! My room was more than I expected.The food was spectacular for all meals and I can not wait until my next visit to Baltimore

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Inn at The Colonnade Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Charles A
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff ready to impress and serve. From Cheryl at the front desk to everyone else at the hotel - all are professional, customer service oriented and aware that you could stay anywhere - they want your next stay in Baltimore to be with them. We were suprised by the quality of food at the restaurant as well. The proximity to JHU sealed the deal. More than anything else though, the staff makes it a great place to stay! They put the "F" in Professional Charles & MarySue Allen - Marietta, GA

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: VLCV
Reviews.Content: We want to thank manager Steve Nyitrai and all of his staff who were so friendly and helpful during our stay. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “The staff here are amazingly helpful”
Reviews.Author: ashlix
Reviews.Content: Oh, where do I start. I stayed in this hotel and the room was totally awesome. I fell into the bed and immediately fell asleep every night. Its right in the campus of John Hopkins University. I had a cool view of the stadium, but it was the staff that made this stay great. From the housekeeping staff to the front desk to the managers, everyone helped me when I was in a major bind. I forgot my Dexter's Laboratory towel AND my work blackberry in my room when I checked out on the 10th. I called the hotel immediately from the airport, they said they would let me know if they could find it. I knew the towel would blend in, because its white, so I didn't expect to get it back, but the blackberry was locked, so I didn't think foul play would happen, but it was my WORK blackberry and has an alarm that will go off in the am. The outstanding staff not only coordinated with calling me back and updating me, but they even followed the smallest detail I left, which was taking the battery out of my phone or it would annoy them all. Within the week I had my Dexter's Laboratory towel and (sigh) my work blackberry back to me in Massachusetts. I can't name any names here, because I want everyone involved in the hotel to get credit with assisting with my stupidity. They all very calmly explained to me what they could do and then did it. I originally wrote off my towel, but then again, when you own something, you want to keep it. I don't even know where I got the towel, but I felt like a part of me was missing without it. I'm about to book another hotel in the DC area in the coming weeks and I completely forgot to do this review. The staff here, of all levels, assisted me way beyond what I would have expected and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant ****1/2 Hotel Close to Johns Hopkins' Conference Centre”
Reviews.Author: eastmagicmountainman
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant four-night/five-day stay at the Doubletree Inn at The Colonnade. Our room was spacious, our beds very comfortable, with large, flat-screened t.v., excellent wifi reception and windows which could be opened to the outside when we desired fresh air. An unexpected pleasure was the happy hour in the lobby with wine, cheese and crackers. The staff was very helpful staff. For us the hotel was conveniently located near the Johns Hopkins' conference center. The hotel restaurant served good food in a nice atmosphere with good service. On the downside, there was no shuttle service to the airport, and the taxi ride was expensive. We also had trouble x2 with the key room cards; however, this was quickly resolved by the staff. Also, there were no towel racks in bathroom. Overall, though, a very pleasant stay, and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Homewood and Roland Park”
Reviews.Author: jamminedward
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a Johns Hopkins Homewood Campus visit. It is very convenient and nice. The Homewood/Charles Village/Hamden/Roland Park area of Baltimore is pleasant for walking and there are many shops and restaurants fairly nearby. If JHU is not in session or on a weekend, street parking is pretty easy, so it's not always necessary to pay this hotel's relatively exhorbitant parking fees (that and a somewhat surly front desk clerk were the only negatives).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: pepeanddizzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid-August to help our daughter move into the dorms at Johns Hopkins. Arrived late (midnight-ish), quick check-in. Went to our room on the second floor--smelled VERY strongly of cigarette smoke, in the hallway & room. Asked to have our room changed, I'm sensitive to the smoke. The (I'm sure they don't call them bellhops anymore, but I don't know what they do call them) guy went down to get our new room key while we chilled for a sec & ate our cookies. Second room, on the third floor was better, but still seemed a little smoky. Otherwise room was fine, clean, lots of towels. Staff was always helpful & seemed cheery. For those who didn't find restaurants nearby (besides the fast foodish, student type things)--there's a pretty good Italian restaurant on W 39th St, about a block away in an apartment building. Maybe a little dressy, but very friendly, and generous portions. In retrospect I'm not sure if the cigarette smoke was due to previous patrons smoking in the room. The hallways always seemed a little smoky to me (but I'm pretty sensitive to it); I wonder if there's a heavy smoker in the condos/apts above, or if workers were smoking near the air vents somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy F
Reviews.Content: Checking in was friendly, fast and easy. The room was absolutely beautiful. They have a wonderful restaurant on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster, From Start To Finish”
Reviews.Author: caliboo
Reviews.Content: Oh, where to start with this hotel!! First off, we checked in very late, near to midnight. The check in process was quick and the valet was exceedingly helpful. Then, the problems began. As soon as we stepped into the elevator, we were hit with an overwhelming stench of marijuana. It followed us up to the third floor, and down at least 2 hallways! Horrible! When asked about it, the valet just said they should be charged a $250.00 fee for smoking in the room. ?????? Our 6 year old kept saying how bad the place smelled. We finally escape the smell down the hall our room was in, which was a relief. Had it not been so late, we'd likely have left. We enter the room. Hubby and valet unload the luggage cart, the rest of us (me, 6 year old son, 2 year old daughter) kicked off our shoes. The carpet was wet. We asked the valet about it, he said perhaps the tub overflowed. We said, what if it was the toilet that overflowed? Called the front desk, was told they had no idea about it. So, we needed another room...who knows what was on that floor and our kids would be playing on it. Off to another room. We had paid for a one bedroom suite. The new room was just a regular room. Not to mention next door to some extremely loud people, who I suspect was the source of the marijuana smell. Completely unacceptable. Off to room number 3 on the night. Same thing, not the suite we paid for. Explained to the valet that we paid for a bedroom, and we wanted a bedroom. OK, hang on, I'll be back. Off to room number 4. SAME THING! Not what we paid for. Finally call the front desk, and got the manager on duty. Upon a suggestion from my husband, he upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite at no additional cost for our trouble. We asked that it be away from the partying, and informed him of the smell in the hotel, and he just said he was aware, but there was nothing he could do. Really, nothing? He said he'd put us on the other side of the hotel. Since it was late, again, we decided to stay. New room, room number FIVE on the night, was a nice room, more than we paid for, we finally settled in and got the kids off to bed. It was a late night for all of us. 8AM our phone rings. The general manager wanted to talk about what happened the night before. So, it was after 1AM when we finally got into our room. I appreciate that he wanted to see if we were OK with everything, but you know what time we checked in....call a little later!!! I was very tired and not overly pleasant to him, I must say. Told him to call back later, but he never did. We were spending several days here, on our way to Ocean City, taking the kids to the zoo and the aquarium. Most of the staff was very helpful. Then, the night before we left, we encountered the life guard. I have never seen a life guard in a hotel before. Ever. It's an indoor pool. We go to swim and are informed that there is no swimming for half an hour due to thunder. Thunder???? What in the world does that have to do with anything, especially inside. Then she said she misspoke and meant lightning. Again, it's an indoor pool! Outside weather does not affect it. There are large doors, that are always open to the outside, but close them! Hello!! Said she was just following the rules. We called the front desk, who said it was OK to swim. Life guard still refused to allow it. Kids are getting upset. She asks us to wait 5 minutes. Whatever. Finally, we get in the pool. Life guard sits her rear down, never takes her eyes off her computer, and has ear phones in. It is lightning the entire time we are in the pool, which we do not call her attention to. She pays zero attention to any of us. The spas are behind frosted glass. If someone had an issue back there, she would never possibly know about it. I watched her the entire time we were in there and she never once looked up. We get out of the pool, and I ask her why she didn't close the pool for the lightning. She was like a deer in headlights, had no idea it was lightning, which was the reason she didn't let us swim when we first arrived. She admitted she did not know. Then went on to say she was completely uncomfortable guarding children and didn't even want us there in the first place. Umm, who needs guarding the most?? Children!!! Her job is completely unneccessary, and she just added to our overall dim view of this hotel. Bottom line, there are far better places to stay in Baltimore and we will not be back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “So so - maintenence and housing keeping need work”
Reviews.Author: TravellerPoland
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 rooms for 4 people - one room was OK to good and one was deeply flawed. To start with the good room - everything worked except the TV remote control was broken. The bad room had a broken air conditioner compressor so the A/c was horriibly loud. The Hotel moved us to another room but this room had a broken smoke detector so again was horribly loud and the hotel had to move us a third time. In the 3rd room it was quiet enough for us to sleep but the TV was completely not operational. Breakfast the next morning was a catastrophe as well for two of us. We asked for no peppers in the 2 of the 4 omlets and no hash browns / potatoes on the side in 2 of the 4 servings. Guess what the omlets came with peppers and there were potatoes. On top of the forgetful service there was a large black hair on top of one omlet - not very appetising. Staff on duty were polite but showed no sense of suprise or shock that 2 rooms in a row were uninhabitable and two TVs were not functional in a normal way. Breakfast received an appolgy but no profound sense of failure. They acted as if this was business as usual. Only when I asked to talk to the manager the next morning did the Hotel offer any sort of appology or compensation. The manager seemed shocked and described the situation as anything that could go wrong did go wrong for one of the two rooms. He rebated us appropriately for that room. So the moral of the story is do not act complacent at this hotel if it is not in correct order.

Reviews.Title: “What a mess!”
Reviews.Author: Claire446
Reviews.Content: Nothing went right, from check in to the toilet, and shower, several attempts to correct issues needed. Have to say it showed no sign of being a Hilton hotel. Room smelled like mold too. Some days are just like this, but most hotels try a little harder to remedy their nightmares!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: foxchasePhila_pa
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased and used a living social deal-great bargain.Never been to Baltimore,but enjoyed the hotel and fine staff .Front desk were extremely attentive.Food great in the hotel restraurant.Only problem was the coffeepot in room not working.Entire staff very pleasany,bed very comfortable-shower enjoyable.Pool times different than advertised,but no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Across from Johns Hopkins, very clean, but....”
Reviews.Author: Blackstone_Dan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overpriced and does not give you any thing but space and a clean room. The inner part of the comforter on my bed had various color marker still on it as though a child had been coloring and missed the paper. Parking is listed at $20 per day for self park, but I was charged $24. When I questioned that, the person at the desk rudely snapped, "It's $20 before tax." As a Hilton Honors member, I will not stay here again!!!! Rude staff are not part of the Hilton requirements!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property across from Johns Hopkins University”
Reviews.Author: thanse39
Reviews.Content: Great location to stay if you are visiting Johns Hopkins University. Beautiful clean property with excellent service from all the employees. Very nice rooms with granite countertops throughout the room. Beds were comfortable. This was a very nice Hilton property. The area around the hotel seemed very safe. We used public transit nearby to visit Baltimore Harbor. Bus fare was only $1.60, very reasonable and clean buses.

Reviews.Title: “dependable and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bakingsister
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Baltimore to visit family and stayed at the Doubletree Inn at the Colonnade. This was our fourth visit to the hotel and as usual we had a very nice stay. The beds are extremely comfortable and the staff are courteous and helpful. The weather was extremely hot and uncomfortable and we were happy to come back to our wonderfully cool room. The bathrooms are very clean and well maintained. This is not a brand new sparkling hotel, but is very well kept. The lobby is wonderful and there is a nice bar in the restaurant. There are probably other hotels that outshine this one, but for money and safe location it is a very good value. The pool is well maintained and there is a lifeguard on duty. There is a Starbucks on the main level but the coffee is weak and not what you would expect from a Starbucks. Do go to the One World Cafe where you will get outstanding coffee drinks and vegetarian fare. They also have eggs and cheese products and wonderful pancakes, waffles and omelettes. Also in the area is Miss Shirley's, a tasty and fun breakfast and lunch restaurant, not cheap but delicious. Try going during the week to avoid the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “20 dollars plus for self parking”
Reviews.Author: jpradonc
Reviews.Content: This place is average but it is pretty much the only choice for people visiting The Homewood Campus of Johns Hopkins University. It is a standard Doubletree but there were some small problems. The rooms are on the second and third floors of this eleven story building. The condominum portion has a seperate entrance and elevators. The rooms had blackout curtains and nice beds. There were no outside sounds but the sounds from the refrigerator and the ventilation system were extremely loud. Plus the air conditioning blew right on the beds and I got a terrible cold in July. I asked for foam pillows and they just gave me extra feather pillows. The staff are very nice. The lifeguarded pool was open for a few hours twice a day. The gym was always accessible with a room key. The restaurant served a full breakfast and dinner. It was mildly expensive. 10-13 dollars for breakfast and 15 to 30 dollars for dinner. It was average to good. There is an excellent restaurant "La Famiglia" which is one block north and west of the hotel. A two minute walk. It is excellent. 105 W 39th St. There is "One World Cafe" which is one block west on University Avenue. The hotel also has a stand alone coffee shop. My main gripe was that self-parking cost 20 dollars a day. But then you also had to pay the garage fees. I had never been to a hotel that did this before. Usually you either payed the garage fees or paid the self parking and used the room key for entry and exit. In my opinion the choice should have been either valet parking (which was 24 dollars a day) or just to pay for it independently without a self-parking charge. The next time that I go to Homewood Campus, I will still stay here but I will not be eagerly looking forward to it. Safety. Baltimore can be dangerous but this place is extremely safe. There is no problem walking around the hotel, the campus or the area two blocks east of the campus (Saint Paul Street).

Reviews.Title: “wonderful bedding”
Reviews.Author: BusyMomof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights to visit Johns Hopkins and see Baltimore. The location is great for JH. I wanted to get a coffee on Friday morning before 8am, but the coffee shop in the hotel was not open yet. None of the cafes nearby were open either and we didn't have time for a full breakfast in the hotel restaurant. We did have a delicious lunch at the hotel. The portions were generous and the salads, soup, burger, and sandwich were all very tasty. The room was good, with excellent air conditioning which we appreciated since it was 100 degrees outside. The sheets and pillows were high quality and the mattress was comfortable (not too hard). We didn't have any problems with noise, but you can hear your neighbors more easily than I would expect for a hotel of this quality. It is nice that the ice and vending machines are located at the elevators and the hallways both have turns before any of the guest rooms. This helps reduce the noise from the machines reaching the rooms. We checked in late (11pm) and did not receive any cookies. My favorite amenity is the free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: mschultz6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Baltimore on business and chose the Doubletree Colannade because we had such a positive experience last year when we stayed here. The room was well furnished with two closets, relaxing decor and beds that were so comfortable it made getting up in the morning hard to do. The room was clean and any requests that we made (how to adjust air, and the need for a toothbrush) were quickly and pleasantly filled. The lobby is large, rather formally furnished with a coffee shop and restaurant/bar with full menu. Our late evening meal was delicious! My husband had one of the best steaks he has had in ages. We will stay here again when on business next spring!

Reviews.Title: “Extenuating Circumstances”
Reviews.Author: gootsybrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade this past weekend and had a wonderful time. The hotel was immaculate and the staff could not have been more accomodating. There were some stressful issues after leaving the hotel which were very upsetting. The hotel manager Steven Nyitrai quickly returned my call and helped me resolve the situation. Thank you Steven! I would highly recommend this to all visiting the Baltimore area!

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Baltimore? Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: poseur247
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not that bad. The pool is small, but the pool room is really cool. The reason I would not stay here again is that it is extremely difficult to get here if you do not have a car. I googled Baltimore transit and the entire first page had the third word as sucks. I should have googled this before, but I got this hotel as an internet special. If you are relying on anything other than your own vehicle or a taxi OR are looking to visit something other than John Hopkins, look elsewhere. The room was adequate. Nothing special. The noise was awful though. You could hear full on conversations in the hallway. The valet service at one time was texting behind the red truck that just pulled up for service. The reviews for the restaurant made it seem really special and good. No one waited on us the first day for breakfast at all. This was not the worst hotel I've ever stayed at but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Tony_blue_3
Reviews.Content: From the minute I walked in I was very impressed. The valet was very welcoming and very knowledgeable of the Baltimore area. They have a great staff on hand. Kelley and Terrel at the front desk made sure that my experience was wonderful and anything I needed or asked for was taken care of. Not all rooms are equipped with a refrigerator and microwave but ask the staff at the front desk and they are more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Johns Hopkins”
Reviews.Author: GardenDee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn for 4 days for business. My conference, being across the street on Johns Hopkins campus, made this VERY convenient. For dining, etc. it was not as much. There was a small “bistro” at the corner “New World Café” that although being a bit eclectic was quite nice – lots of locals. A little Italian restaurant is located nearby in a residential condo, not in a commercial area. Also, just down the street from the bistro is a great little market for snacks, wine, etc. All within safe walking distance. Also, I ate at a restaurant on the water in the industrial area called Frankie’s on the Pier. Very authentic and a great outdoor patio. This hotel has a nice bar and restaurant, a bit high, but typical for business clientele. They don’t open until 5:00. There is a nice business center with complimentary printing. The rooms are fabulous and great bedding, etc. All in all, great for a Johns Hopkins business locale.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Lackluster”
Reviews.Author: lawtalk
Reviews.Content: I was going to give this hotel four circles, but it really only deserves 3, or 3 1/2. Except for the concercierge guy, the employees were rather sullen. Upon entering the hotel, you THINK it is going to be really good, but it is really just average. Or a little bit above average. For example, the carpeting in the hallway on our floor could certainly be replaced. Also, it is quite far from the Harbor area, so you will spend a lot of money on cabs. Further, I was surprised that they had no airport van-----I noticed that even the Microtel had that. So add $40 in cabfare, each way, to your estimated expenses. Further, we stayed here because it was close to Johns Hopkins University, where my 17 year old son was going on a college tour. While it IS close to Johns Hopkins, it is not particularly close to the admissions office, where they do the tours, which is on the other side of the campus. So again, while I would like to rate this hotel as "good", it was vaguely disappointing, in a way that is hard to precisely articulate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely visit to Johns Hopkins University”
Reviews.Author: cll45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting JHU and had a wonderful trip. The room was clean and nice (no problems with the room at all) and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is great for business on the JHU campus. We had a nice breakfast in the hotel restaurant as well. Overall, a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: M33star
Reviews.Content: I've stayed the the Colonnade many times. This time I thought it was needing some attention. It was not possible to set the AC in the room so that we could control the cooling. More than once we had to get the repairman to fix it. Water also dripped from the bathroom ceiling, but that was apparently fixed or stopped. The restaurant and bar have slipped. We couldn't even get a drink in the bar after dinner. It closed at 10 pm.which seemed rather early for a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Gave it a chance and I wasn't impressed”
Reviews.Author: benfen6293
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this property to be closer to my meeting on the following morning. This was my first stay at this property. Overall the property appears in good condition although it is apparent that the hotel is not new. My room had a smell of uncleaned carpets. Some noticeable signs of wear and tear existed along with deferred unattended maintenance. Parking is self or Valet, $20 or $24 respectively. Used unattended to carpeting will direct me to choose another property in the future, drive or not.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars From A frequent Traveler”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveler043
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for over 100 nights for the past two years. The staff is extremely accommodating (especially Chasity, Will, Terrell, and Sheryl) and I have never had even a single thing go wrong in all of my stays. This is a nice, quiet, and well located property. I can easily recommend this hotel with 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Love working with the staff”
Reviews.Author: kallen14
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review because I wanted to acknowledge Chasity Michailov, the Revenue Manager. I contact Chasity often to make hotel reservations for guest to our college; and Chasity is always very helpful and gets back to me the same day with reservations. She is always there if I have any questions and is very efficient. Thanks for Chasity, she makes my work day so much easier

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: jhuparent
Reviews.Content: I am writing as a regular guest of the Doubletree Inn at the Colonnade in Baltimore, Maryland. I stay there at least once per month, sometimes more as I have two children enrolled at Johns Hopkins University. Each time I arrive, I am always greeted warmly by the valet staff--they take wonderful care of the car and are so helpful with all the luggage and cargo, especially on dorm move-in, move-out days. The front desk staff is thoughtful, helpful and couldn’t be more accommodating. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Housekeeping and maintenance staffs are prompt with any special requests for extra supplies or services. I reserve my highest praise and compliments for Chasity Michailov, the revenue manager of the hotel. I have had the pleasure of knowing Chasity for several years now (my oldest child graduated this past May, having spent four years at JHU). She is very organized, quick to respond to reservation requests, friendly and extremely talented at her job. I have made countless reservations through her and she has always done a great job finding me the right room or room combination. Always one step ahead of the game, Chasity recently e-mailed me about an upcoming JHU event that she knew I would be attending. She noticed the hotel was filling up fast and she wanted to secure a reservation for me. I am so grateful to her for contacting me and organizing my stay for August. She is truly the definition of a valuable employee. Congratulations on running a wonderful hotel which is attentive to every detail, employs a friendly and very helpful staff, offers comfortable and spacious rooms and greatly deserves my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: The2Travelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree Inn for 3 nights – Sunday, 6/12 to Tuesday, 6/14. My husband was attending a business seminar which was held at the hotel. Overall it was a disappointing stay and we would not stay here again. Location – The location of the hotel is inconvenient unless you have business at Johns Hopkins University. The street outside the hotel is very busy, both day and night, noisy with traffic, and police and ambulance sirens. In addition, our suite overlooked what appeared to be a construction staging area that was very unattractive. Staff – The staff is inconsistent, ranging from very professional and friendly (Eric, the lifeguard at the pool and the lovely woman who brought bottled water to our suite every day) to unconcerned and aloof (the Sunday afternoon front desk staff who, when asked about the hours of the pool, told us they didn’t know and that we should go and look for a sign on the pool ourselves). Suite – Upon check-in we were brought to a junior suite whose A/C was extremely loud and rattling. At our request, we were moved to another suite. The A/C was quieter (but still loud) and seemed to be on an arbitrary timer that switched on at odd times of the day. The suite itself was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. The couch and chair in the sitting area of the suite, however, were extremely uncomfortable. Each area of the suite had minimal lighting – a single lamp in the sitting area provided insufficient light for reading at night and on a cloudy day. During the day, I had to leave the curtains open in order to have enough light to read. The furniture on the outside balcony was filthy and I had to clean it several times before being able to sit on it. Food – The Continental breakfast was adequate but the single server seemed confused and ill trained. The restaurant area itself was rather dark and musty. I ate there one morning and never went back. Pool – The pool was closed every day from noon until 5:00 PM. This seems ridiculous since these are the prime hours when a pool would be used. Price – Way overpriced, both for the room and the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean, but not overly friendly”
Reviews.Author: Bluegrassdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we were going to the Preakness Stakes (horse race). Most importantly, it is a very clean, well-kept, stylish enough hotel. It was a little expensive, but it was a busy weekend, apparently. There were some minor glitches-- the air conditioning in our room didn't get very cool, the television pictures were a bit fuzzy-- but overall, the room was clean. The odd thing was we felt like we were staying "by ourselves." The front desk staff was not very friendly on check-in, and nobody went out of his/her way to be welcoming or friendly. My one big complaint is that I specifically phoned the hotel a week before we checked in and asked if there was alternative transportation to the airport. I was told there is ONLY taxi service, when in fact, there was a less expensive, reliable shuttle service. The other problem is that the location is lovely and terrific if you want to be near Johns Hopkins campus, but we spent a small fortune in taxis. If you look at a map, it looks quite central, but it's about $15 taxi ride to/from the Harbor, and to/from Pimlico Race Course. As a comfortable hotel, it's fine. Very clean, free and reliable internet, a little bar....just don't expect overwhelming friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & quiet hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jabmorrill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Inn at The Colonnade for a week to attend a training in May 2011. The Inn staff were very friendly and professional. My room was spacious, comfortable, clean, and blissfully quiet. (I slept better there than I typically do in hotels.) The fitness center was small but very well-equipped and (hooray!) open 24-hours. I will definitely stay there again should I return to the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Professional”
Reviews.Author: dcgress
Reviews.Content: I was attending some training for the week and found the staff to be very polite and cordial. The restaurant is upscale but not stuffy. The rooms were very clean and beds very comfortable. Thanks again, I'll stay with you the next time I'm in Baltimore ! D.Gress

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel - first class and we will return”
Reviews.Author: RLO81
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I have hosted our seven day training program at the Doubletree Inn at The Collonade. The food, the ambience of the hotel lobby and most important is the professional staff that has made our stay not only enjoyable but memorable. I believe the success of any endeavor is to make sure you have an understanding of your client's wishes. It is all about the details - this property sets the bar - on a scale of 1-10 my rating is a solid 10. I travel world wide in my business - this is my best experience and it is consistent. Keep up the fine work. R. Oatman

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Asantewab
Reviews.Content: I have been booking guests at The Inn at the Colonnade for approximately two months now and their service is top notch! Recently, a guest experienced problems with her cooling system and the staff took very good care of her and moved her to a more comfortable room immediately. I have had great service and professionalism from everyone to the front desk to the GM, to the dir. of special event. The food in their restaurant is delicious as well too!

Reviews.Title: “If you can't be home, stay there”
Reviews.Author: Sprortsmom
Reviews.Content: I feel as though I could do a commercial for the Inn at the Colonade. Back in March my daughter, an athlete at Johns Hopkins University had ligament damage after a sports related event. Two weeks ago they scheduled her surgery for Tuesday, April 26, 2011. When I arrived the front desk staff was as kind as always. When I got to my room I saw that the room was not accessible to someone using crutches or a knee scooter because the room had a lot of sharp turns, big furniture and a toilet behind the door, that you could not access without getting in the small bathroom. That said the front desk was overly accommodating in allowing me to try a few different rooms, without making me feel as much as a pain, as I felt like I was being. In the end the only one that worked because of its large and wide thorough-ways, and large bath, with bath-tub she can hang her leg out of was accommodating. That night we moved her in and left at 6 AM the following morning. I asked the front desk to put a rush on cleaning my room once the staff arrived and please send extra pillows to elevate her leg. We arrived back, everything was as I had asked. When we needed even more pillows, they were there quickly. Housekeeping has been amazing. Extra pillows, towels for bathing her, cleaning the room when it is good for her in and out medicated sleep schedule. The front desk has alerted me when flowers and UPS arrived. Everyone has been overly accommodating and if I couldn't be at home with her, I am glad I was here. The smiles and helpful nature of the restaurant staff, front desk staff, housekeeping and management, make this the only place for us to stay. On behalf of my daughter and myself, thank you, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Our great experience at this hotel started the minute we arrived.”
Reviews.Author: thevisitor1958
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were visiting a friend at Johns Hopkins University and wanted a hotel that was close. This hotel is close,but that's not the only reason to stay there. The staff is UNBELIEVABLE!! Friendly, efficient, knowledgeable about the area and directions(to the degree that the valet told me to call her if I got lost on the way home!). Upon check in you are given a "warm from the oven" chocolate chip cookie that is heavenly-nice touch.The room was pleasant and larger than I expected, and while the walls are a little thin, it was comfortable. The gym is nicer than most - good and new equipment all set in a room with lots of light pouring in. The biggest surprise was the restaurant. The service was again, great, but the food - gourmet - really. We look forward to more visits and next time - we'll ask for more cookies!

Reviews.Title: “Want the best accommodation at a reasonable rate...gotta try this one”
Reviews.Author: bharrie
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Inn at the Colonnade was exceptional. It was a great location to John Hopkins University (viritually across the street) with convenient shuttle to John Hopkins Hospital and School of Medicine. Hotel restaurant was great....the best crabcakes ever!!!!! The Sunday brunch was delightful. There are great local restaurants within walking distance in the Homewood area. The Super Shuttle to and from and BWI was convenient are was a great price. Taxis are immediately available as well. When I return in a month, this is my first choice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: jmmhouston
Reviews.Content: Not only is the hotel friendly, accommodating, clean and as close as you can get to Johns Hopkins, they saved my iPad! I had left my ipad in the business center and only realized it after I was half way back to the airport. I phoned the front desk and the woman on duty I wish I had her name, asked me to call back in a few minutes while she went to search for my ipad. I called back and in fact she had located the ipad, brought it to the front desk and was prepared to get it to me in any manner I requested. I asked that they wrap the ipad in newspaper to protect it and to put it in a Fed EX cardboard box. I received the ipad the next morning! The next morning, I received my ipad, good as new, wrapped up in newspaper at my next hotel. Mr. Joshua Watkins had completed the Fed Ex airbill. Please send my thank you for the wonderful customer service that was provided to me...your staff made me feel very relieved to know my expensive belongings were in safe and competent hands.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service for banquet event”
Reviews.Author: jpoling3
Reviews.Content: We hosted a dinner for about 2 dozen guests at the Inn at the Colonnade; every aspect of the service was excellent and courteous. Wayne Hooper of the sales office was especially helpful getting things arranged for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - avoid the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LMD24
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, especially for a conference or meeting. We had a good experience overall - clean, great location, friendly staff. At the end of the conference we had dinner at Alizee restaurant. (About 30 of us with a prix fixe menu.) Unfortunately, the food was overcooked, no flavor, and we waited 90 minutes for the food. (Not exaggerating, wish I were.) Since some people had to leave to catch early flights, they returned to their rooms around 9:30pm and we (the university hosting this conference) had to pay for their prepaid meals. Since we meet once a year, this was unfortunate and left it on an uncomfortable note with these international guests. In the future, we'll stay there because of the location, but go elsewhere for the end of the conference dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel was WONDERFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonGal16
Reviews.Content: Wayne Hooper and the other staff helped us every step of the way as we planned our week-long conference. Then they made our week-long stay a dream! They delivered on every promise they made and then some. We could not have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Kim Cetrone, the bartender was INCREDIBLE how refreshing!”
Reviews.Author: stephchris_11
Reviews.Content: I met her my first night here, on SuperBowl evening with 2 colleagues. I went in to the restaurant 2 days later, and she greeted me by name and also remembered the names of my 2 colleagues! She is ALWAYS smiling! It was extremely refreshing to be remembered and I felt appreciated as a client. She is a fantastic asset to your organization! Please give her a raise :) Also, she stuck her hand over the bar and introduced herself. Nice approach.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Down to Business”
Reviews.Author: doherty26
Reviews.Content: We recenly had our company party at the Colonnade and everyone had a great time! The staff was attentive and polite and the food was delicious. Every stage of the planning process was made easy by the wonderful manager and the day of execution exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, warm cookies, but a little far.”
Reviews.Author: ls4881
Reviews.Content: I stayed from a Sunday eve to a Friday afternoon the first week in January for business. The hotel staff was warm and welcoming, greeting us with warm cookies at our late arrival. The room was very comfortable and clean. I was a little disappointed that the indoor pool was closed for the season, but the exercise room was clean and open. I had a loud snorer in the room next to mine for two nights, and unfortunately the hotel did not have ear plugs. It is conveniently located to Johns Hopkins, but not very close to local attractions (such as Little Italy or Inner Harbor). They were just a cab ride away though. The manager was accessible and accommodating. Also, the lunch that was provided daily for our conference was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - quiet stay and attentive and pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: Aje_aje
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Baltimore for training for my job and stayed at the Double Tree where the training took place. Everything went well. I enjoyed my peaceful room. I was on a tight budget so did not try the restaurant or bar but walked to the Johns Hopkins campus for a Subway sandwich and other more cost efficient restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for JHU, exorbitant parking rates”
Reviews.Author: CPtraveller
Reviews.Content: The location right next to the Johns Hopkins campus is convenient, if that's where you want to be. It's just a few blocks walk (to the south east) to a small college town neighborhood with some stores and basic eateries. The rooms are entirely fine, and the staff was helpful. Free wifi is always a plus. My only complaint was the exorbitant parking rates.

Reviews.Title: “Office Holiday Party was a Success!”
Reviews.Author: michs2
Reviews.Content: We just had our annual work holiday party at the Inn at the Colonnade last week. Everything went seamlessly and our group had a great time. There was plenty of staff available to see to our needs and as the party planner, I didn't have to do anything but enjoy the evening along with my co-workers. The event coordinator was very helpful and great to work with. I would definitely recommend this venue for future events.

Reviews.Title: “This has to be the BEST kept Secret in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: mrskhicks
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and have stayed at the best on the East and West Coast, and all i can say is the entire stay was five star! If you want the Five Star stay for the Three Star bill... stay at this hotel. In fact, my stay was so good, i am returning for another two week stay and my office in DC is only 37 miles away! Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Biz Guru and Pampered My Pet Too!!”
Reviews.Author: smitchtrack
Reviews.Content: Awesome service!! As a repeat Biz traveler, I will continue to return. I need excellent Internet connection - the manager went over and above to accomodate my needs - even to running a cable up the stairwell until I had what I needed. I also was there for a JHH procedure, and it was wonderful to be able to have a great eatery within the property for both room service and in person. AND my poodle Karma was treated like the special traveler that he is - with a pet bed in the room when we arrived!!

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth it”
Reviews.Author: Holnek
Reviews.Content: I was at Hopkins for some business and stayed for one night. Here are some pros and cons and why I'm giving this place 2 stars. Pros: Good location if you going to Hopkins Rooms at big - suite style so comes with small living and sofa bed Refinished interior Cons: Self parking is $20 with no in and out privileges - must do valet for $24 Small bathrooms Expensive for the quality Very small gym! Expensive breakfast for very mediocre food - $14 full buffet but I think a hampton inn free breakfast actually tastes better with more variety to choose from Staff service is not incredible

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating & caring service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hajdunanas
Reviews.Content: We had an extended stay in a king suite, since we were having renovations done at our home as a result of water problems. The staff was very considerate trying to make our stay comfortable, from managent down to housekeeping! Hotel kept very clean, housekeeping very helpful in keeping everything up, great beds & linens, can sleep well! Good location, walking distance to alot of restaurants, but taxi always available, 10 min drive to downtown. Hotel in a residential neighborhood safe for jogging, right across from Hopkins university & 3 blocks from Baltimore museum of art. To sum it up being at this hotel made a difficult time for us a lot easier to withstand! Thank you! To whole staff for being so caring!!! Edith & Avery

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: jhu12345
Reviews.Content: Left an item at the hotel and they kept it for me for over a week until I could get back to retrieve it. I always have the best night sleep when I stay here and the rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Stays Give Support To Positive Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveler043
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property over 100 nights during the past 12 months. The rooms are always clean and the staff is very accommodating. Owing to the proximity to Johns Hopkins University, there are many things to do nearby. Finally, the hotel restaurant serves up excellent food in both the dining room and room service settings. This is a safe choice for the traveler that wants a quiet, comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and gracious staff”
Reviews.Author: Dreamn18
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself went to check out Johns Hopkins University on Nov. 8 and 9. We stayed right across the street at the Doubletree Inn at The Colonnade. The location couldn't have been better. Upon arrival the valet both unloaded our car, brought our bags to our room and then when I realized I had forgotten a couple of items in the car, he went back down and got them for me. All while being very patient, kind and gracious. He then parked our car in the underground garage for us. Nice way to start the visit! The room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. The lobby is very pretty, spacious and clean. All in all a nice hotel that I will stay in each time if our daughter chooses to go to college at JHU.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay...”
Reviews.Author: CaddoConcours
Reviews.Content: Each time I've had the chance to stay here I've found the rooms to be comfortable and very quiet. The staff keeps this hotel very clean. Dinner -- both food and the service -- in the restaurant was excellent. Other than not having Fox News Channel, this was a very enjoyable visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in hospitality and comfort”
Reviews.Author: DCG52
Reviews.Content: This hotel and staff are on par with hotels of much higher price. Great value, the parking could be better priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and compassionate management and staff while at Johns Hopkins hospital.”
Reviews.Author: TomBoehJones
Reviews.Content: Recently, we were in urgent need of accommodations near Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore, Maryland. The Double Tree Inn at the Colonnade was where we were finally able to stay. If you are looking for excellent service and compassion in time of need, this should be where you should stay. They provided us very low rate parking, round trip cab service from the Inn to the hospital, and complimentary breakfast by their excellent restaurant. My highest praise to the employees from the front desk, to the valets, to the wait staff in the restaurant, to the maid service, and to all levels of their management. When we were asked why we were staying on an extended stay, and they were made aware of my daughter's illness, they all wished her well and would put her in their prayers. That was their expression of the compassion we appreciated, since it came from their hearts. What more could you ask for. Thank you, Tom and Carole Jones Richmond, VA

Reviews.Title: “It was a wonderful and safe place to rest and relax each and every night.”
Reviews.Author: HarlemFinest
Reviews.Content: I would first like to start off by saying that the accommodations were excellent. I enjoyed the warm reception that I received once arriving at the hotel and it continued throughout the week. Hats off to your staff!!. The meals were very delicious and the restaurant's atmosphere was very relaxing and inviting. The room was beautiful, clean and comfortable. I really enjoyed being a guest at the Colonnade it made my trip very pleasant . Thank you for the professional staff that you have and please express my deepest appreciation to them for making my stay a memorable and enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come hungry”
Reviews.Author: BDfromDC
Reviews.Content: This is the second Doubletree Hotel in a row I've stayed in, the other being the DOubletree Charlottessville VA, where Sunday breakfast was a mess. In this case, the restaurant had closed early at 9:15am for "maintenance" and there was no notice whatsoever to guests. To stop breakfast at 9:15 on a weekend is outrageous, but to not tell your guests is unbelievable. There wasn't even a coffee urn or danish set up. A drink the night before in the same lounge came to us wrong (on the rocks vs up), and then the waiter bartender just dumped it in a martini glass when we realzied his mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Guests were very comfortable and enjoyed the amenities. Great location too!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMedM
Reviews.Content: I have organized for two guests to stay at this hotel before doing some work at Johns Hopkins University.The staff was quick and efficient. My guests, after a nights stay, were very comfortable. Dinner at the adjacent restaurant, Alizee, was great and the late night bar had some good selections. Best of all, the location was prime. It is essentially on campus and only minutes away from the harbor. If you would like a very pleasant stay at a great location and at a decent price the Inn is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: Castor2002
Reviews.Content: I had no complaints with this hotel. The staff was wonderful and resource-full, to notch all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “My husband & I came to Baltimore because...”
Reviews.Author: DHSalazar
Reviews.Content: My husband & I came to Baltimore because I was having medical testing at John Hopkins. Upon arrival we were greeted with fine & courteous personnel. I had requested a "handicapped accessible room with a walk-in shower with the shower chair". Room was not a true accessible room. (1)No shower chair -had to call & request one..even though it should have been there to begin with. (2)NO grab bars next to toliet. (3)NOT enough turn around space in bathroom. (4)Beautiful balcony -NO wheelchair access. (5)Room was small - barely enough room to pass in wheelchair from one side of the room to the other. I will need to go to John Hopkins 3-4 more times and I will NOT stay here. Beware Disabled Traveler!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff on the planet!”
Reviews.Author: JessKnea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this beautiful hotel for two days and I have NEVER met a more caring staff! I was greeted by registration, housekeeping, maintenance staff, and the GM - all with a smile and a greeting and a question as to how I was enjoying my stay! I began to keep count, as I was so surprised by the thoughtfulness. I met with NINE different staff people who greeted me and inquired as to my stay! FaNtAsTiC customer service! . . . and by the way - the hotel is lovely, food in the Alizee restaurant was hot and fast, overall one of the best I've ever stayed in!!

Reviews.Title: “What Staff?”
Reviews.Author: 3cats99
Reviews.Content: Although in a perfect location for visiting JHU, this hotel appears nice enough at first glance, but in reality, it is a zero service operation. I observed guests lugging their own bags, maids asking in the hall "if your checking out please throw the safety latch on the way out so I can get in", no newspaper, no executive floor for elite program guests, no ancillary amenities of any kind. I cannot imagine that people would pay as much as $250 per night for this hotel, as it simply does not offer anything one would expect at this price level. As the rooms are passable enough for a short stay, if you can get in this hotel in the low $100's, fine, no complaints, but otherwise not money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Travelor”
Reviews.Author: dogpoundhouse
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to drop a line to say how much I have enjoyed my evening with the hotel staff. I have to say the front office manager is just darn awesome her hospitality is so genuine and heartfelt and the young man offering his assistance they are the heart of the hotel. I have been experiencing problems with my key, I had to come down to the desk several times to have my card rekeyed even though it was an inconveience to me the manager was just wonderful and comforted me and gave me a warm cookie for the evening. I come to Baltimore often and it was great to find a home away from home and then to be taken care of by the staff. I would recommend the hotel to my friends and family as long as you keep things the way they are. The restaurant is a great scheme but it could be much better with affordable non puffy food. Sometimes guest simply want a home cook meal that does not cost an arm and a leg Just a suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “No Room at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler023
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation at the Doubletree Inn at Colonnade for 9/18/10 through AARP Travel which uses expedia.com. We were visiting family and attending the Yankee/Orioles baseball game that night. Arrived at the Doubletree Inn at 3 pm for check in time and found out we had no reservation and no room. Seems they require a two night stay so they did not book the room. Expedia and AARP failed to notifiy us. They gave us our confirmation # and charged our credit card $194.88. Doubletree Inn claimed it was expedia.com's fault and expedia.com claimed it was the hotel's fault. After 2 hours (lost time for our visit) of phone calls, a room was found for us in another town, 20 minutes away. We did stay there, Hilton Garden Inn, and it was nice, but not in the city where we wanted to be. At check out on 9/19/10 I asked for and received a receipt for the room totaling $148.00. Upon returning home, I again spent hours on the phone with AARP Travel powered by expedia.com and was told that since they did get us a room, they would credit us $13 for the price difference. What math is that? My calculations come up with $46 difference. I was told by AARP Travel that the Hilton Garden Inn should not have given me a receipt with that price as it is the price that they charge expedia.com. Needless to say, we fail ripped off. The staff at the Doubletree Inn were nice and they were helpful, but leaving people stranded is not right and then ripping them off!!! I suggest that no one use expedia.com or AARP Travel.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our needs”
Reviews.Author: susanbeth
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Doubletree at the Colonnade in Baltimore Md and chose this hotel because of it's great proximity to Johns Hopkins University. It is literally across the street. We were immediately greeted by folks at the front desk with a warm welcome as well as the famous warm chocolate chip cookies. Our rooms were ready, clean and roomy. The staff was consistently courteous, friendly and ready to help us with all of our requests. As it was move--in weekend for Hopkins students, the staff remained calm, pleasant and we never felt that they were overwhelmed. I needed to stay an extra night, and despite the heavy volume of people at the hotel, a room was made available for me. We are heading back this weekend and in October and plan on staying there for future trips to Baltimore. The only drawback is that the parking is not included in the hotel stay. There is a parking garage but there is a fee for parking.

Reviews.Title: “big room, elegant hotel, convenient to JHU Homewood campus”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights while visiting the Johns Hopkins Homewood campus. Walking distance to buildings on campus. I had a large room with a sitting area and king bed.
