Quiet room despite facing the front of the property and main road. For a few hrs one afternoon there was noise from the stadium but it did not inconvenience me. Staff was excellent all around, room was clean and well maintained. Dinner was great, breakfast was good, and they have vending machines for drinks and snacks although I could not get the drink one to work. Fitness ctr is modest and the elliptical trainer was broken - my only significant complaint. I used the treadmill instead. Water bottles in my room was a nice touch - it might be from my Hilton elite status I'm not sure but it meant I did not have to buy bottled water - a big help when there is not much around and one is walking to campus. Valet parking was expensive $24/day similar to self-park. But they did a good job with the car. I'd definitely stay here again if I had to visit this location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: rdu10
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very attractive and comfortable; rooms spacious and well-appointed. Business event ran smoothly thanks to staff members' willingness to help and attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Place to Relax, Enjoy Fine Dining, and Work - All the Best”
Reviews.Author: WalterBaltimore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have had the opportunity to have many wonderful experience during all our stays (more than 15) at this hotel. We have stayed here together and separately - for leisure and business travel and have always looked forward to our next visit. We have seen continuous improvement over the five years that we have stayed at this hotel. The food - which was already excellent - is even much better. Be sure to try the omelette in the morning and the salmon at night. We are usually out and about during lunch hours so I cannot speak about the lunch menu. My wife and I are both experienced travelers and we know a great place when we see one and stay at one! There are many other hotels in Baltimore; however, this is where we want to stay. We are extremely disappointed when we hear the words "there is no room at the Inn." The service - beginning with the auto valet has always been outstanding - and the desk staff always accomodating. The bell persons are helpful and the cleaning staff are friendly. The small things are always right - enough soft towels, bottled water in the room, well functioning heating and air conditioning, and new flat screen TVs! This hotel is always #1 on our place to stay when we have a meeting within a 50-mile radius. We don't mind the extra drive time if it means we can stay here. Be sure to ask for a room with a balony - sitting outside and watching the sunset was one of our best hotel experiences! The rooms are spacious with a fridge, nice furnishings, and an extremely comfortable bed. The hotel is located near Johns Hopkins University campus - a real treat! It is also located within an upscale, quiet neighborhood which means you can walk around and enjoy the ambiance provided by a treed area. So many things to comment on - a smile comes to my face as I attempt to write about other things. The only "bad" thing that I can think of is that I am never able to stay as long as I wish!

Reviews.Title: “First rate in every respect.”
Reviews.Author: Choroszy
Reviews.Content: From the time my son and I checked-in (presented with warm cookies) to the time we left, we were treated with great service and hospitality. The bell hops, front desk, and support staff are all top notch. Simply, true professionals. If I happen to frequent the area again, I will not hesitate to make a reservation here. I would certainly recommend this Doubletree Inn to any of my family members and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Service could not have been better-very nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jerzeeguy
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated. Rooms are very nice and spacious for the two of us and our dog. Shower was excellent. Service could not have been any better. All of our requests were acted on promptly and efficiently. Hotel staff remembered our names (including our dog). Could not have treated our dog any better. Provided him with a large pillow and dog biscuits. They did not forget us as we were give warm cookies on our arrival. Very friendly and comfortable environment. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, awful service, outdated”
Reviews.Author: businesstravel60614
Reviews.Content: I ordered a simple crab cake from room service. Not only did it take 70 minutes for it to arrive, after they estimated 25, but it tasted awful, the portion was tiny, and the staff was rude. Save your money, if you stay here, eat anywhere, anywhere but at the hotel. Do yourself a favor and check into the Sheraton. Also the area was lackluster despite being close to Johns Hopkins campus. The fitness center is also set to about 100 degrees and is extremely humid. Don't even attempt to work out in it. The ceilings are about 6 feet high therefore it also gets LOUD. The machines are old and dusty as well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: JBABJ
Reviews.Content: My family traveled to Baltimore to drop our son off at Johns Hopkins for the second half of the summer. This hotel was a terrific place to stay. Not only is it located right across from the stadium at Hopkins, but the rooms are very comfortable, the internet is free, and the beds are really cozy. My only complaint would be that the bathrooms are small, but we didn't spend much time there so it didn't matter much to us. Parking is extra so be prepared for that. We got a great deal that included breakfast, and the breakfast was very nice. The staff are helpful and pleasant. Oh, when you check in you get a yummy, warm chocolate cookie!

Reviews.Title: “Legendary Baltimore Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveler02
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Inn at THE Colonnade is the PERFECT residence for business or leisure travel in Baltimore. This handsome hotel is located in one of the POSH Baltimore residential communities, next to the beautiful Johns Hopkins Homewood Campus and near the famous Baltimore Museum of Art. Downtown Baltimore is a few minutes away by car or public transit. The quiet hotel rooms are a special treat with 40 Flat Screen TVs, high quality bed and bath linens, luxurious bath products and a high powered hairdryer. In addition to a full laundry service, each room comes with and iron and ironing board. The Doubletree Inn staff makes every request their special pleasure to accommodate. Gracious, legendary, Baltimore hospitality at its best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for visiting hospital/university area in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Youngfan75
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent price via Priceline- Amost 2/3rds off any website! I was having surgery at Union Memorial Hospital which is only 2 blocks away. Nice walk to the hospital, during daylight. Then took a taxi back after surgery. Very nice employees starting with the door/valet, front desk, housekeeping. Nice sized room with pillow top mattress and pleanty of pillows. Seperate sink area from toilet/bath, good if you need to have 2 people getting ready to go somewhere. Good water pressure and pleanty of hot water. My wife went to the wine bar for a glass of wine, she stated it was very good and only $6.50 a class.TIP ;Order food from the menu in wine bar and carry to your room- You save delivery charge$ and get more of a selection over the room service menu.Crabcake sandwich was very good, nice remolade on the bun. BTW, cost of valet parking $25/night, could be worse for in city parking.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but could use better service”
Reviews.Author: TrottaGnam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 4-5 times in the last 10 years. Convenient to Hopkins and walking distance to a couple of decent restaurants. Rooms are okay, though last time we had a double bed instead of a booked queen/king (even though the hotel claimed it was a "queen" -- it was NOT!). The Alizee restaurant at the hotel was not bad; not great, but pretty decent. Less stuffy than the Polo that preceded it in the same location. We had a very nice and helpful waitress. The gym is small but nice: clean and functional. One problem was that the room wasn't cleaned one of the days. The front desk said it was because the do-not-disturb button was pressed. (This could've been the case). However, when we called at 5pm to ask for the room to be made up, it took 2 more calls and 3 hours. In fact, no one came to make up the room but they just brought us some toiletries and towels. (After 2 hours of waiting we had to sneak some fresh towels out of the maids' closet). Another tidbit: this hotel hosts some interesting conventions. During the weekend we were there, it hosted a "Fetishist Convention" complete with booths, presentations (which we sadly :-) didn't get to see) and handouts. There sure were some interesting characters walking around. (Glad that we didn't bring kids with us). Most attendees were pudgy, tattooed to the max, middle-aged (and higher) and very very white...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, top-knotch Service”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentTraveler80
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel itself has a very classy lobby and the room was nice, to us the most incredible part about this hotel was the staff. Very helpful and accomodating, the staff made our visit extra-special. Again and again, we were so impressed with how everyone there went out of their way to help us and get what we needed. The one warning is that street parking is not available, and the valet parking was an added expense that we did not expect. However, we highly recommend this very special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: suekush
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for families visiting Johns Hopkins because it is literally across the street. The staff is wonderful. They give you warm chocolate chip cookies at check in. Seemed clean. BUT: the room was incredibly dim. There was a shortage of both lights and wattage in the ones that were there. Also, we couldn't adjust the heat/ac, so sleeping was tough for one family member. We'd return - with flashlights.

Reviews.Title: “Double Tree review..”
Reviews.Author: july86nikki
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel it was very clean. The employees were very nice. We only stayed there one night but it was beautiful. The bed was so comfy i didnt want to get out of it. We got a suite and it was so big it looked like a house..had a little kitchen area,living room area,nice bathroom with tub and shower. All around it was a lovley stay

Reviews.Title: “Great room, if only the airco noise were not there...”
Reviews.Author: AlfredoLP
Reviews.Content: I have been using this hotel a number of times in the past decade or so, and I am sort of used to it. During my last visit I got a great room (a suite, actually) that I much enjoyed, with the exception of the horrible -- and unstoppable -- hum noise from the airco system. It did stop and restart a number of times during the night, even waking me up. A bit of a shame, given how nice the room was...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but under renovation”
Reviews.Author: MD0919
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a girls weekend.......hoped to use the spa, cut closed. The staff was the best part, room was nice and restaurant had good food, but only one fairly pricey place to eat without going into downtown Baltimore. Hotel undergoing renovations, looks nice but pool, spa, small convenience store all closed and nowhere to walk for anything else. Staff was great however, very responsive to our needs. Having a spa and a mid price eating option on site would make it a pretty great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: honestfeedback2010
Reviews.Content: We had 48 hours to complete a complicated project. We used our large, comfortable room as home base and continually made unusual requests of the staff as our deadlines loomed. They cheerfully provided extra paper and envelopes for the business center, postage for dozens of items, extra cookies, and an extended stay -- all with courtesey and style. The only downside to the hotel was the lackluster and overpriced breakfast. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and regal, you are special when you stay here”
Reviews.Author: tkasper3
Reviews.Content: Although we booked with expedia and the "breakfast buffet" was listed as included; the hotel was not informed of this and still honored our reservation with the buffet. Everyone was set to please us; the patron. Very refreshing. Rooms, service and hotel was top of the line even if the pool was not open. The workout room was bright and fresh. We would return. The restaurant was 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ackrunner
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, including all the staff. The fluffy duvets and pillows, the warm cookie upon arrival and the overall professional yet friendly staff all made this a go to place for future trips. It's location to attractions in the city is ideal. The food at the hotel bistro is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect guest relations.”
Reviews.Author: lmfields
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Inn at the Colonnade in Baltimore the night before my surgery at Union Memorial. The staff treated us extremely well. Warm cookies were given to us on our arrival. We had to have our car brought to us the following morning at 5:20 a.m. to go to Union Memorial Hospital. The valet parking was extremely helpful and the valet even wished me well with my surgery. Great customer service. The rooms were beautiful. Starbucks coffee in the room. Hopefully, my next visit will be for leisure and not medical related. Awesome hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: JJF1
Reviews.Content: I used to love this hotel. I went to Johns Hopkins in the mid/late 1990s and this hotel was great, five-star restaurant, elegant rooms, top-notch staff. What the heck happened? The restaurant where I had the continental breakfast with my wife offered grey-colored bananas, highly watery oatmeal, and the server delivered our coffee and told us if we wanted milk we'd have to get up and get it ourselves from the bar - do we carry our full coffee cups across the room to the milk and then back? or go across the room, get the silver milk pitcher, bring it over to our coffee, and then back to the bar, and then walk back to our table? Not only is this not fancy, it's crazy. The heat in my room blew from a vent in the side/top of the ceiling directly on my head the whole night. The room decor looked old. The only saving grace was a really nice front desk lady.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing that saves this property is Alizee Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ladyinmaryland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property as part of a New Years Eve package that included a 5-course dinner at Alizee and $59.00 for a king size suite. The dinner and service at Alizee was impeccable as was the case when we dined there for Thanskgiving. However, the Doubletree check-in service left much to be desired. The gentleman who checked us in was unimpressive and we simply felt unwelcomed. The room was acceptable, but we were disappoined that the king size suite did not contain a refrigerator (as is custom in all of the Hilton King suites I've stayed). On New Year's Day we awoke to barely have hot water to shower and used it as an opportunity to share a shower. I reviewed my bill to find I was charged $24.99 for valet service that was included as a part of the package. This was removed from my bill, again by a staff member who again was unfriendly and seemed bothered by my request to have the charge removed. As a Hilton Honors Status Member, not a property I would ever recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Holiday experience - I have every reason to return!”
Reviews.Author: stephnickAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bit off the highway - but with the GPS, it is easy to reach. The lobby was decorated BEAUTIFULLY for the holidays and the staff was very friendly when I arrived, late in the evening. I was greated with a warm chocolate cookie (their trademark) and two friendly faces at the registration desk. My room was luxurious leading me to wonder what the rate was - $85.50 for the night with AAA! The bed was so comfortable I never turned during the night. Absolutely beautiful, and I have every reason to return!

Reviews.Title: “We are grateful for the hospitality shown to our college age daughter during her stay at the Colonade.”
Reviews.Author: ckpost
Reviews.Content: Sending our daughter off to college for the first time is an exercise in letting go. We originally stayed at the Colonade back in August as a family (when dropping our daughter off for her freshman year at JHU). During our week long stay, we became friendly with many of the staff members at the hotel. The hospitality extended by the employees made us feel welcome in a city that can otherwise feel big and intimidating to people like us who come from a small town. One of the employees who made our stay most enjoyable was Paul Masai. He greeted us with a smile and warm cookies every day of our stay and seemed genuinely concerned and attentive as to how our stay was going. Since the Colonade is right across the street from the JHU campus, we talked with Paul about the possibility of having our daughter stay at the Colonade during stressful times (e.g., during finals) so that she could have a brief respite from the chaos of dorm life and get a restful night's sleep on occassion. Paul told us to call him anytime and he would personally make sure that her visit was nothing short of relaxing. With finals week ahead of her, we decided to book a stay in December and as promised we contacted Paul to let him know when our daughter would be arriving. Paul returned our call right away and he assured us that he would make sure that everything was taken care of when she arrived. True to his word, Paul not only made sure that our daughter's stay was restful, he also put her safety first by reserving her a room on an upper floor in a non smoking room, with no adjoining rooms. Paul arranged the perfect room for her where it was quiet enough for her to study and where she felt safe. My husband, our daughter and I are so grateful for the extra care and attention that Paul (and his staff) gave to our daughter during her stay. It is comforting to know that even though she is far away from family, there are kind people (such as Paul and staff) who care enough about others to make sure that they provide a safe and restful environment for their patrons at the Doubletree Inn at the Colonade. Many thanks to Paul for arranging such a comfortable stay for our daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, elegant hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: ccandmike
Reviews.Content: This is a copy of the letter I sent to the manager of the Inn of the Colonnade this past week,after our second visit there ....this is a wonderful place to stay. Beautiful surroundings and competent, top-notch customer service! Dear Manager, Please extend our heartfelt gratitude for the excellent service and care we received this past week at your hotel. My husband and I first stayed at the Inn in mid-September, when he came to Baltimore for a consultation at Johns Hopkins for his cancer. We were still in shock from his diagnosis, and needed to work out many emotions. The room you provided was beautiful and we so enjoyed every minute, relaxing in the whirlpool bath and on the balcony, watching life continue around the university as we made important decisions. The staff was wonderful, even though very few knew of our situation; this was all the better because we knew that they genuinely cared about customer service overall, not just because we were going through a difficult situation. When we heard that my husband needed major surgery and could have it done at JH, we again decided to stay at the Inn. We came down actually a night early, so we could spend some time together before his surgery on Oct. 7th. Again, the staff was wonderfully caring and supportive; they were there to help, whether it was with directions around the city, getting our car at 0500, allowing us to get breakfast items from the café the evening before (to take along since we left so early), or offering a warm fresh-from-the-oven cookie. You all earned a perfect “20”; a “10” certainly isn’t high enough for your hotel! I will also be mentioning your Inn and the quality of your services when I write to Johns Hopkins. I feel they should know about your excellent hotel so that they could recommend you to their patients and their families who are not from the area. Your team made so much difference for us as we went through this ordeal. Thankfully, we think that my husband will eventually be fine….the operation was successful, but he needs to recuperate and get back to normal over the next 6-12 months. Thanks again for all you did…we hope to be able to return in the future!!!! Blessings,

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant is comically bad.”
Reviews.Author: COM4
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are clean but rather dark, especially the sitting rooms in the suites. Service is a little lacking - the phone in my room didn't work and wasn't fixed when I requested it. The balconies are nice. The gym is a poor effort. Proximity to Johns Hopkins Homewood is unbeatable. The staff is a mixed bag. I have had nice conversations with a manager-type guy and with the maintenance staff. When I asked someone at the front desk for a suggestion of a good restaurant to take a business client downtown, she suggested Hooters... I have stayed at this hotel several times, and it seems to me that each time I am there, the restaurant is under new management with a new name but the same clueless staff. I had a lunch there that was disgusting. Huge hunks of bread and undercooked chicken. The following morning I had a breakfast meeting that was absurdly bad. The buffet eggs were green and they only make one omelet at a time. Plus, the waiter brought us our bill before anyone had consumed so much as a sip of coffee. I've never seen that done before.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: AngelAware
Reviews.Content: Disregard all negative reviews. Great place to stay. Excellent service and super staff. Quiet, nice location for couples or business. Room was very clean and comfortable. Definitely put this on your favorite hotels list.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore's Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: newyorkfamily1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Colonnade to look at Loyola University for my daughter. This hotel was perfect for the occasion! First off, it is located very close to both Loyola and Johns Hopkins University. The area is nice overall. The lobby was breathtaking. Not only was is huge, but it was SO fancy! I don't understand why it only got 3 Diamonds AAA! The staff were all very friendly, courteous, and helpful. Check in was quick and easy. And the Doubletree Cookies are to die for!!!!!! We booked the "Fun" rate which gave you the room, a large pizza, popcorn, a free movie rental, and the next day FULL breakfast for 4 people! At 169 a night, it was a real bargain! Another good thing about the Doubletree is that the hotel is surrounded by and connected to Condos. The good thing is that loud and obnoxious tour groups or weddings have to keep it down and be out before 10! This is a real plus! The room was awesome too! We got the 2 Queen Beds Larger Room. It was huge! The beds were big and comfortable, the bathroom was fancy and large, and there was a sitting area! All wonderful! As far as tech, there was FREE internet (Yay!), and a big flat screen TV with a lot of channels and movies. The area is nice. There is a Ruby Tuesday around the corner which was a great place for dinner! Beware of the EXTREMELY TIGHT parking quarters in the neighborhood. Not a big deal, though. Parking at the hotel is $24 a day valet (one time fee) and $20 a day self, but the self is far away and you have to pay a fee when you leave every time. Weird! Breakfast the next day is at Alizee, the onsite restaurant. Not only is the restaurant really nice, the food was GREAT! The omelette guy is amazing! There was eggs, bacon, sausage, taters, toast, danish, pastry, cereal, fruit, etc. Also be sure to try the Choc. Milk. Best I've ever had! Beware, though. If you are looking to see the Downtown Baltimore (inner harbor, camden yards, malls, etc.) DON'T GO HERE! This hotel is far from those places and not at all convenient. It is perfect for visiting the colleges, like we did. Overall, a great hotel and a great stay in Baltimore. This hotel is truly a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn in Westin clothing”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S
Reviews.Content: As a one-time resident of Baltimore's Roland Park-Homewood area -- it's my favorite part of the city -- we chose the Doubletree Inn at the Colonnade purely for its location, which is lovely. It's lovely by the way if you're not married to being in the Inner Harbor or in other truly urban Baltimore neighborhoods (like Fell's Point and Inner Harbor East). This hotel is prime for people with connections to Johns Hopkins University (mind you, I'm talking about the university, not the medical campus whose proximity is more toward Fell's Point, a whole other part of the city). The weekend we were there we saw numerous families (with boisterous kids who overpowered the tiny indoor pool) and wedding events. Still, very pleasant if unremarkable. We booked a suite and from what I could tell when wandering through halls when housekeepers were working, it was the same space as regular rooms (with slightly fustier furnishings, certainly no flat screen televisions while standard rooms had been upgraded) though suspect our bathroom -- with jacuzzi tub -- was an upgrade. Hate the kind of "suite" that basically puts the living room at the entrance (with no windows). Didn't really care for the room, frankly (though did appreciate the empty mini-fridge and liked the bathtub). The other thing I didn't love about the hotel was that despite all these great outdoor spaces -- two patios off the pool, an area off the entrance that clearly has been marked as a gathering spot because chairs and tables, as yet unwrapped in mid-June and so useless -- was that the urban/suburban nature wasn't properly addressed. The restaurant (Alize something or other) seemed rather sad sack (though we enjoyed the bar), definitely not possessing any kind of buzz. In fact the hotel itself had a sort of sad sack air about it. Hallways reminded me of the kind of airport hotel that tracks in one night stays. The smoke scent in our room, ugh. Will we stay there again? The Doubletree Inn at the Colonnade was certainly inoffensive but memorable? I love the neighborhood but next trip to Baltimore we'll give a try to the Radisson at Cross Keys and explore our urban/suburban options.

Reviews.Title: “Spring at the Colonnade for work and lacrosse and alumni activity”
Reviews.Author: bluejaylax1978
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Colonnade for all of the above reasons. I have had multiple stays at this hotel over time. It is the optimum location for me personally for business reasons in Baltimore and especially for Johns Hopkins alumni functions. Its proximity to Homewood Field permits me to avidly follow the country's most successful and storied lacrosse program. I have recommended the hotel to many friends over the years.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel here is a well-kept secret in Baltimore........”
Reviews.Author: popececil
Reviews.Content: The management here has got it together. Everyone there was very gracious, and seemed like very happy employees. Very classy place at a fair price. You feel comfortable immediately upon entering the hotel. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “DOUBLETREE BALTIMORE IS TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: INDILongIsland
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience. Booked in Jan for a June visit, confirmed directly with hotel staff night before arrival, confirmed details of suite. On arrival told suite not available, could only give room with two double beds for our family of four. Room turned out to have one double bed. Went back to desk and then given two adjacent rooms, with a double bed each, no connecting door, but figured my husband and I would have to each sleep in one room with one child. One room stank of cigarette smoke. Returned to desk again, manager personally took us to another pair of room, both of which stank of smoke. Management stated rooms were smoke free but would place machine to filter air. Machine had no effect. Finally management decided to give us suite larger than origianl booking. ENTIRE CHECK IN PROCESS TOOK OVER TWO HOURS WITH US RUNNING BACK AND FORTH TO DESK TO CHANGE ROOMS. Although hotel conceded and did not charge us for one of the two nights, the time spent was worth much more than the cost of the room to my husband and me (we are a software development consultant and a physician respectively). Will never ever stay at a Doubletree hotel or indeed a Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pam12475
Reviews.Content: I think most of the crappy reviews were written before this hotel was given a complete renovation in December 2007. First, the hotel staff was nothing but wonderful and friendly, and helpful. The place looks new, with all the renovations done. The room was great with granite countertop in bathroom, wall in shower, and counter in walkway (coffee pot area). Flat screen tv, mp3 player plug in on the alarm clock, and very quick valet service. I would suggest valet instead of self park due to the fact that with valet it is one price per day ($24) no matter how many times you go in and out. There was a nice outdoor garden area with tables and chairs set up. We ordered in and ate out there. We have 2 children under the age of 3, so going out to dinner can be a hassle. We really enjoyed our stay, and would come back here on our next visit to Baltimore without question.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: collegetraveler1
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Johns Hopkins University and needed a place to stay. The university directed us to the Colonnade; I called and was given a room on the spot at the university guest rate. For the convenience, the rate was excellent. To avoid the hotel parking fee, we left our car in the university parking garage and schlepped our luggage across campus. The front desk was very hospitable and helpful and the complimentary cookies were a nice touch! The room must have been recently renovated because it was more than we expected -- spotless; beautiful marble bathroom; wonderful, soft beds, HUGE flat screen TV; and more. Excellent value. We will definitely stay here if we need to be close to the university again. The only thing on our wish list would be complimentary, continental breakfast. Traveling with a prospective college student can be pricey and we look for the 'little things' to help us cut costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Too Many Issues”
Reviews.Author: Often_on_road
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Johns Hopkins University. In that regard, the location is excellent -- across the street from the campus. However, the stay was not excellent. For the premium prices charged, this property should have a high level of customer service and quality settings.There were so many issues that we will thoroughly check out other hotel options for our visit next year. Issue One: Parking. No where on the website or when you check in are you told that you will have to pay every time you enter and leave the garage. A 1.5 hour stay was $8 alone in the garage. Overnight is an additional $20. Come and go several times and your parking expense can become very prohibitive. Issue Two: Front Desk. We only encountered one person at the end of our stay who we would consider customer oriented. Others we encountered were indifferent at best and seemed put out to have to talk or help a customer. Issue Three: No door on the bedroom. The suites are advertised as having a separate bedroom. Yes, there is a bedroom area, with a wide entry to it; no door. The set up was more typical of a low end suite hotel; not a hotel that charges $300 for a suite. So, if you want a private bedroom to allow someone to watch TV and others to sleep, this will not work. Issue Four: Other room issues. These included a refrigerator that did not work, a TV in the sofabed area that was older and had a fuzzy picture, a sofabed that was too short for a shorter person to sleep on with legs fully extended, a ragged blanket to use with the sofabed, a bathroom with laminate flooring as the ceiling, and a small size for a $300/night room. Yes, the balcony was nice. The room and bathroom were very clean and lots of towels were provided. Issue Five: Business center. Yes, there were two computers to use. However, the printers did not work and the front desk indicated that we and other guests would have to wait to the end of his shift until someone could figure out the issue. This is the only location for printing out boarding passes. This is a hotel that seems to think it has a captive audience with its location and has to do little to obtain a full house. Maybe that is true, but how much of that business is repeat customers? A strong attention to certain cost structures (such as the garage pricing policy) and customer service is greatly needed.

Reviews.Title: “The Colonnade is reborn”
Reviews.Author: dynamicdoll
Reviews.Content: First impressions is definitely a lasting impression. The lobby is breath taking. During check in there were several other people checking in, there were two front desk clerks at the time of my check in, then from out of the back office two other people came out to help the two clerks. They were very helpful with getting us checked in to our rooms. I believe the fitness center is new it has all new equipment which made my workout very enjoyable. My room was very clean with a huge flat panel tv. The bed was soft my husband thought it was too soft, but I sleep like a baby. Our overall experience was fantastic. I'm visiting Maryland again in July 2008 and I will look to book with the Inn at the Colonnade again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we had a renovated room?”
Reviews.Author: juniemonster
Reviews.Content: I'm guessing we had a renovated room, because we did not have the problems that I read in the other reviews here. We thought the lobby was very fancy. Our room was small (even though it was called a "large room"), but it was very nice. It had nice comfy beds, and was definitely newly painted. The room itself was very clean. There were no problems that I noticed with the room at all. The hotel was still undergoing renovations. We saw some areas blocked off with tape, but it didn't bother us (we also had a room right by the elevator, so didn't have to walk down many halls). We did have a problem when we arrived that the electronic keycards were all broken, so you had to have an escort to your room each time. They didn't check our i.d., which made me wonder a bit about security. The one part of the hotel that was still gross was the garage. The garage looked like a dump. There were dirty old sofas and stained mattresses laying all over the place, and it smelled horribly. We could hardly breathe down there. I don't know why they just had them piled up down there. They also stored the garbage in a sloppy manner right outside some of the rooms by the alley. We didn't have a room with that view, but it sure wouldn't be nice to have the "garbage view". All in all, it looks like the Inn is improving. The staff were very nice, and hopefully they can finish cleaning this place up.

Reviews.Title: “Run! Run Fast!”
Reviews.Author: Calforever
Reviews.Content: It took me 9 months to write this review. I stayed at this crappy hotel in January, 2007 because I was taking classes at Hopkins. The lobby belies what the guest rooms truly are. I thought I was at Motel 8 when I first walked into the first room I was assigned to. It was dark, grungy, and the bathroom had a shower stall that needed MAJOR repair and updating. I asked for a change of room because the curtains had a stench of old tobacco smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room. My next room was a tad better, brighter and cleaner, although I had to put up with a toilet with a leaky flush, peeling wallpaper, and dangerous half-hanging electrical wall sockets. I didn't change to another room because I was afraid what I might be assigned to next. I swear, it was like playing russian roulette! The front dest staff could sometime be friendly and helpful, but only if there was a manager in the vacinity. It is shameful that this property is part of the Hilton family. I had submitted a complaint to the Hilton Corporation in 2/07. It is now 9/07 and I am still waiting for a response.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced pile of dirt”
Reviews.Author: veildancer9
Reviews.Content: I was misled by a nicely appointed entrance and front desk area, but once I stepped off the elevator onto my floor, it all went downhill- total, disgusting disaster! I had to walk through long unkempt (dirty, messed up carpets and walls) hallways- half the hotel was undergoing renovations and these areas were open to the public rather than partitioned off. I was greeted with a waft of the odor of cigarette smoke upon arriving at my room. Not only was my room supposed to be non-smoking, but it's a non-smoking hotel. I asked to speak with someone about a price adjustment as the conditions in the room were less than savory. I was told that because I had made an advance purchase online, the hotel had not yet received the money from the outside vendor that handles their advanced online sales (Please note- I made my reservations directly on the hotel website, NOT Travelocity or a similar site). They claimed that since the hotel did not receive their payment, they could not work with me on the exhorbitant price I paid for a room that reeked of smoke. I asked to speak with a manager- they were able to find a supevisor for me, who said they will try to get in touch with their outside vendor regarding payment to see if they could then work with me on the price. I was told that someone would get in touch with me the next morning. No one contacted me and no one addressed my request. Entering the bathroom, I noticed a Q-tip on the floor. I gave them the benefit of the doubt- perhaps it had fallen out of my own bag. However, when I looked in the shower and found used bottles of shampoo in there, I knew the bathroom had not be cleaned. Housekeeping did visit after my call, after about a half hour wait. When visiting the restaurant, I asked if I could order something for "takeout"- after spending so much on a room that missed the mark, I did not want to spend extra for room service. I was told that they do not do that. I went back to the front desk to inquire about why this was so- it turned out to be a misunderstanding- the waitress thought I wanted to order from the room service menu and not have it delivered to my room. However, I was surprised that after expressing my disappointment in the room's conditions, the hotel staff did not offer my measly $6 salad "on the house". The hotel was very noisy too- their air conditioning systems and some type of fan was very loud, noisy and disruptive. The room rate was astronomical, particularly given the fact that it was not up to par. I could have flown halfway across the country for the same price!! The staff, I do have to say, was very nice, and seemed to want to accommodate me but given the hotel policy, they could not. This policy is horrid and there is no reason why they couldn't have shaved some money off my bill, given the unsatisfactory conditions. I was also shocked that I was, in essence, penalized for paying in advance. I should have been accommodated all the more, not less!! I was thoroughly disappointed in this hotel- very dusty and dirty room! Very overpriced! Would never go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “convenient to JHU, not that great otherwise”
Reviews.Author: elchang
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonnade with my family because my brother was graduating from JHU. For our purposes, it was nice because it was so convenient to the campus, but it was way, way overpriced during graduation week, and the rooms weren't even that large and/or that nice. My card key malfunctioned pretty much every time I tried to use it, so I got pretty well acquainted with a lot of the front desk staff since I had to get my key reprogrammed so often. The breakfast buffet was similarly overpriced and not that great. After the first day, we ate at nearby restaurants instead. Brasserie Tatin is a few blocks away and is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “again, nice lobby, shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: marriagerightsforall
Reviews.Content: Similar to other review, we found the lobby to be glitzy, but the rest of the hotel is falling apart. The rooms were very plain. The bathroom was missing grout and had a growing case of mold around the tub. Not what you'd expect from an EXPENSIVE hotel. It seems they are riding on 2 things, and 2 things only: 1- the nice lobby 2-being across the street from Hopkins. Unfortunately we also found the front desk staff to be quite rude. We were also suprised to find that the pool was no more than 3 feet deep in all places. Great for young kids, but not for adults (unless they are accompanying small kids).

Reviews.Title: “A little run down”
Reviews.Author: rondracek
Reviews.Content: I was a student at JHU when this hotel was being built (20 years ago!) and always thought it looked so nice from the outside. I finally had my chance to stay at the hotel when I was invited to participate in an alumni advisory committee in April 2007 (I did not have to pay for the room myself). I have to say I was a little disappointed with the hotel. First, the rooms are kind of dark and a little run down. Next, I could not figure out how to set the clock, let alone the alarm (it had the wrong time!) and the lock of my room was pretty bent and worn (but it did still lock). It was unusually warm when I was in Baltimore and I had a difficult time getting the room comfortable. After crawling into bed, the bottom sheet kept coming untucked from the mattress (I hate that!). During my stay, I saw furniture just left in the hallway (and overheard the discussion of the staff, "I wonder what that's doing there?"). In addition, I did not find the front desk staff to be overly helpful when I needed to schedule a 4:00 am taxi. On the good side, the food we were served on our first night's meeting was outstanding. In short, the hotel is great for convenience to the JHU campus, but is in need of renovation (which they said they were doing) and some improvements in service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visting JHU, a little worn around the edges”
Reviews.Author: panicked
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to Johns Hopkins Homewood Campus and Charles Village, but not close to much else. The staff was very accomodating during my stay. They switched my room when I showed up before check-in time so I wouldn't have to wait for my original room to be cleaned. I think that some strange charges and refunds on my bill resulted from this, but the staff was again very helpful in sorting it out and printing me a new bill on checkout. The key card machine wasn't working when I checked in, so they sent someone from housekeeping to meet me at my room and let me in, and called me when my key was ready. They were also very helpful with tips on how to get the semi-functional ATM in the lobby to work (unplug it and plug it back in to reboot it). All of that being said, I was a little disappointed with the condition of my room. It was small and rather dark. The furnishings were somewhat worn. No mini-fridge. It seemed like there was a shampoo shortage because when I arrived, my shampoo was half-empty, and wasn't replaced during my stay. Good points: I love the DoubleTree cookies. Free wireless internet. Helpful staff. The most convenient hotel to JHU. The pool/solarium looked nice. Not so good: The rooms need a renovation (they appeared to be renovating something in the lobby when I was there). Not close to the Inner Harbor or BWI. And what's with the shampoo? Check out: Tamber's Nifty Fifties Diner at 34th and St. Paul. It's a 50's style diner with Indian food. It sounds weird, but it works. Try the chocolate malts, Kashmiri naan, and chicken korma. Also: The Ambassador restaurant behind the DoubleTree has good Indian food in an elegant quasi-British Colonial setting. They open up the patio doors in the summer and seat you in the garden with tablecloths and hurricane lamps. And: The tiramisu at Donna's at 31st and St. Paul. It's the size of a brick and light as a feather.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree Inn at The Colonnade
HotelInfo.Address: 4 West University Parkway, Baltimore, MD 21218
